intro: Dissotis glaberrima, commonly known as the smooth dissotis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants such as spiderworts and water hyacinths. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often near water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and wetland conservation efforts.
